==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|𠄎|t1=strain|夂|t2=go slowly|ls=ic}} – straining and slowly moving (because having trouble with the abundance of goods carried).

From the ''[[w:Shuowen Jiezi|Shuowen]]'': “秦以市買多得爲夃。[[從|从]]𠄎从夂，益至也。从乃。[...]乃，難意也。” (“During the [[w:Qin Dynasty|Qin]], purchasing too much at the market was known as 夃. Derived from 𠄎 and 夂. It means "to exceed/augment." [𠄎 is] from 乃. [...] [In this context] 乃 means strain/trouble/difficulty”)

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=gū,gǔ,yíng
|c=gu2,gwu2
|mn=go/gó
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi|pin=[[gū]] ([[gu1]]) or [[gǔ]] ([[gu3]])|wg=ku<sup>1</sup> or ku<sup>3</sup>}}
: {{lb|cmn|archaic}} of [[賈]], to [[buy]] (excessively/abundantly)

{{zh-hanzi|pin=[[yíng]] ([[ying2]])|wg=ying<sup>2</sup>}}
: {{lb|cmn|archaic}} of [[赢]], to [[augment]], [[increase]], [[add]]

===Usage notes===
The "[[yíng]]" reading is only used for the "to augment, increase, add" definition.
